info.title: Instructure Canvas Accounts API
info.description: Canvas LMS includes a REST API for accessing and modifying data externally from the main application, in your own programs and scripts.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional information to include.nu201clti_guidu201dnnthe 'tool_consumer_instance_guid' that will be sent for thisnaccount on LTI launchesnu201cregistration_settingsu201dnnreturns info about the privacy policy and terms of usennn        n        n          Allowed values: lti_guid, registration_settings

parameters.name: account[domain]
parameters.description: The domain to use for this account.

parameters.name: account[external_integration_keys][salesforce_account_id]
parameters.description: no description

parameters.name: account[name]
parameters.description: The account name.

parameters.name: account[services]
parameters.description: A hash of service settings. If set

parameters.name: account[settings]
parameters.description: A hash of account setting options. If set to

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: no description

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: no description

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: no description

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: campus name

parameters.name: account_notification[end_at]
parameters.description: The end date and time of the notification in ISO8601 format. e.g.n2014-01-01T01:00Z

parameters.name: account_notification[icon]
parameters.description: The icon to display with the notification. Note: Defaults to warning.nn        n        n          Allowed values: warning, information, question, error, calendar

parameters.name: account_notification[message]
parameters.description: The message body of the notification.

parameters.name: account_notification[start_at]
parameters.description: The start date and time of the notification in ISO8601 format. e.g.n2014-01-01T01:00Z

parameters.name: account_notification[subject]
parameters.description: The subject of the notification.

parameters.name: account_notification_roles[]
parameters.description: The role(s) to send global notification to.  Note:  ommitting this fieldnwill send to everyone Example:nnaccount_notification_roles: ["StudentEnrollment", "TeacherEnrollment"]

parameters.name: user_id[]
parameters.description: Scope the results to those with user IDs equal to any of the IDs specifiednhere.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: (deprecated) The user's admin relationship with the account will bencreated with the given role. Defaults to 'AccountAdmin'.

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: The user's admin relationship with the account will be created with thengiven role. Defaults to the built-in role for 'AccountAdmin'.

parameters.name: send_confirmation
parameters.description: Send a notification email to the new admin if true. Default is true.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The id of the user to promote.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: (Deprecated) Account role to remove from the user. Defaults ton'AccountAdmin'. Any other account role must be specifiednexplicitly.

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: The user's admin relationship with the account will be created with thengiven role. Defaults to the built-in role for 'AccountAdmin'.

parameters.name: date_shift_options[day_substitutions][X]
parameters.description: Move anything scheduled for day 'X' to the specified day.n(0-Sunday, 1-Monday, 2-Tuesday, 3-Wednesday, 4-Thursday, 5-Friday,n6-Saturday)

parameters.name: date_shift_options[new_end_date]
parameters.description: The new end date for the source content/course

parameters.name: date_shift_options[new_start_date]
parameters.description: The new start date for the content/course

parameters.name: date_shift_options[old_end_date]
parameters.description: The original end date of the source content/course

parameters.name: date_shift_options[old_start_date]
parameters.description: The original start date of the source content/course

parameters.name: date_shift_options[remove_dates]
parameters.description: Whether to remove dates in the copied course. Cannot be used in conjunctionnwith shift_dates.

parameters.name: date_shift_options[shift_dates]
parameters.description: Whether to shift dates in the copied course

parameters.name: migration_type
parameters.description: The type of the migration. Use thenMigrator endpoint tonsee all available migrators. Default allowed values:ncanvas_cartridge_importer, common_cartridge_importer, course_copy_importer,nzip_file_importer, qti_converter, moodle_converter

parameters.name: pre_attachment[*]
parameters.description: Other file upload properties, See File Upload Documentation

parameters.name: pre_attachment[name]
parameters.description: Required if uploading a file. This is the first step in uploading a file tonthe content migration. See the File Upload Documentation for details on the file upload workflow.

parameters.name: settings[file_url]
parameters.description: A URL to download the file from. Must not require authentication.

parameters.name: settings[folder_id]
parameters.description: The folder to unzip the .zip file into for a zip_file_import.

parameters.name: settings[overwrite_quizzes]
parameters.description: Whether to overwrite quizzes with the same identifiers between contentnpackages.

parameters.name: settings[question_bank_id]
parameters.description: The existing question bank ID to import questions into if not specified innthe content package.

parameters.name: settings[question_bank_name]
parameters.description: The question bank to import questions into if not specified in the contentnpackage, if both bank id and name are set, id will take precedence.

parameters.name: settings[source_course_id]
parameters.description: The course to copy from for a course copy migration. (required if doingncourse copy)

parameters.name: workflow_state
parameters.description: Set the workflow_state of the issue.nn        n        n          Allowed values: active, resolved

get.summary: List active courses in an account

parameters.name: by_subaccounts[]
parameters.description: List of Account IDs; if supplied, include only courses associated with onenof the referenced subaccounts.

parameters.name: by_teachers[]
parameters.description: List of User IDs of teachers; if supplied, include only courses taught bynone of the referenced users.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: If true, include only completed courses (these may be in staten'completed', or their enrollment term may have ended).  If false,nexclude completed courses.  If not present, do not filter on completednstatus.

parameters.name: enrollment_term_id
parameters.description: If set, only includes courses from the specified term.

parameters.name: enrollment_type[]
parameters.description: If set, only return courses that have at least one user enrolled in in thencourse with one of the specified enrollment types.nn        n        n          Allowed values: teacher, student, ta, observer, designer

parameters.name: hide_enrollmentless_courses
parameters.description: If present, only return courses that have at least one enrollment.nEquivalent to 'with_enrollments=true'; retained for compatibility.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: All explanations can be seen in the Course API index documentationnnu201csectionsu201d, u201cneeds_grading_countu201d and u201ctotal_scoresu201d are not valid optionsnat the account levelnnn        n        n          Allowed values: syllabus_body, term, course_progress, storage_quota_used_mb, total_students, teachers

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: If true, include only published courses.  If false, exclude publishedncourses.  If not present, do not filter on published status.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial course name, code, or full ID to match and return in thenresults list. Must be at least 3 characters.

parameters.name: state[]
parameters.description: If set, only return courses that are in the given state(s). By default, allnstates but u201cdeletedu201d are returned.nn        n        n          Allowed values: created, claimed, available, completed, deleted, all

parameters.name: with_enrollments
parameters.description: If true, include only courses with at least one enrollment.  If false,ninclude only courses with no enrollments.  If not present, do not filter onncourse enrollment status.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the account to create to course under.

parameters.name: course[allow_student_forum_attachments]
parameters.description: If true, students can attach files to forum posts.

parameters.name: course[allow_student_wiki_edits]
parameters.description: If true, students will be able to modify the course wiki.

parameters.name: course[allow_wiki_comments]
parameters.description: If true, course members will be able to comment on wiki pages.

parameters.name: course[apply_assignment_group_weights]
parameters.description: Set to true to weight final grade based on assignment groups percentages.

parameters.name: course[course_code]
parameters.description: The course code for the course.

parameters.name: course[course_format]
parameters.description: Optional. Specifies the format of the course. (Should be eithern'on_campus' or 'online')

parameters.name: course[end_at]
parameters.description: Course end date in ISO8601 format. e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z

parameters.name: course[grading_standard_id]
parameters.description: The grading standard id to set for the course.  If no value is provided fornthis argument the current grading_standard will be un-set from this course.

parameters.name: course[hide_final_grades]
parameters.description: If this option is set to true, the totals in student grades summary will benhidden.

parameters.name: course[integration_id]
parameters.description: The unique Integration identifier.

parameters.name: course[is_public]
parameters.description: Set to true if course if public.

parameters.name: course[is_public_to_auth_users]
parameters.description: Set to true if course if public to authenticated users.

parameters.name: course[license]
parameters.description: The name of the licensing. Should be one of the following abbreviations (andescriptive name is included in parenthesis for reference):nn'private' (Private Copyrighted)nn'cc_by_nc_nd' (CC Attribution Non-Commercial No Derivatives)nn'cc_by_nc_sa' (CC Attribution Non-Commercial Share Alike)nn'cc_by_nc' (CC Attribution Non-Commercial)nn'cc_by_nd' (CC Attribution No Derivatives)nn'cc_by_sa' (CC Attribution Share Alike)nn'cc_by' (CC Attribution)nn'public_domain' (Public Domain).

parameters.name: course[name]
parameters.description: The name of the course. If omitted, the course will be named u201cUnnamednCourse.u201d

parameters.name: course[open_enrollment]
parameters.description: Set to true if the course is open enrollment.

parameters.name: course[public_description]
parameters.description: A publicly visible description of the course.

parameters.name: course[public_syllabus]
parameters.description: Set to true to make the course syllabus public.

parameters.name: course[restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates]
parameters.description: Set to true to restrict user enrollments to the start and end dates of thencourse.

parameters.name: course[self_enrollment]
parameters.description: Set to true if the course is self enrollment.

parameters.name: course[sis_course_id]
parameters.description: The unique SIS identifier.

parameters.name: course[start_at]
parameters.description: Course start date in ISO8601 format, e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z

parameters.name: course[syllabus_body]
parameters.description: The syllabus body for the course

parameters.name: course[term_id]
parameters.description: The unique ID of the term to create to course in.

parameters.name: enable_sis_reactivation
parameters.description: When true, will first try to re-activate a deleted course with matchingnsis_course_id if possible.

parameters.name: enroll_me
parameters.description: Set to true to enroll the current user as the teacher.

parameters.name: offer
parameters.description: If this option is set to true, the course will be available to studentsnimmediately.

parameters.name: course_ids[]
parameters.description: List of ids of courses to update. At most 500 courses may be updated in onencall.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: no descriptionnn        n        n          Allowed values: offer, conclude, delete, undelete

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: u201call_coursesu201d: Also search recently deleted courses.nnu201cpermissionsu201d: Include permissions the current user has for the course.nnu201cobserved_usersu201d: include observed users in the enrollmentsnnn        n        n          Allowed values: all_courses, permissions, observed_users

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enrollment object

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial name of the tools to match and return.

parameters.name: selectable
parameters.description: If true, then only tools that are meant to be selectable are returned

parameters.name: account_navigation[enabled]
parameters.description: Set this to enable this feature

parameters.name: account_navigation[text]
parameters.description: The text that will show on the left-tab in the account navigation

parameters.name: account_navigation[url]
parameters.description: The url of the external tool for account navigation

parameters.name: config_type
parameters.description: Configuration can be passed in as CC xml instead of using query parameters.nIf this value is u201cby_urlu201d or u201cby_xmlu201d then an xml configuration will benexpected in either the u201cconfig_xmlu201d or u201cconfig_urlu201d parameter. Note thatnthe name parameter overrides the tool name provided in the xml

parameters.name: config_url
parameters.description: URL where the server can retrieve an XML tool configuration, as specifiednin the CC xml specification. This is required if u201cconfig_typeu201d is set tonu201cby_urlu201d

parameters.name: config_xml
parameters.description: XML tool configuration, as specified in the CC xml specification. This isnrequired if u201cconfig_typeu201d is set to u201cby_xmlu201d

parameters.name: consumer_key
parameters.description: The consumer key for the external tool

parameters.name: course_navigation[default]
parameters.description: Whether the navigation option will show in the course by default or whethernthe teacher will have to explicitly enable it

parameters.name: course_navigation[enabled]
parameters.description: Set this to enable this feature

parameters.name: course_navigation[text]
parameters.description: The text that will show on the left-tab in the course navigation

parameters.name: course_navigation[url]
parameters.description: The url of the external tool for course navigation

parameters.name: course_navigation[visibility]
parameters.description: Who will see the navigation tab. u201cadminsu201d for course admins, u201cmembersu201d fornstudents, null for everyonenn        n        n          Allowed values: admins, members

parameters.name: custom_fields
parameters.description: Custom fields that will be sent to the tool consumer, specified as custom_fields

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the tool

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The domain to match links against. Either u201curlu201d or u201cdomainu201d should be set,nnot both.

parameters.name: editor_button[enabled]
parameters.description: Set this to enable this feature

parameters.name: editor_button[icon_url]
parameters.description: The url of the icon to show in the WYSIWYG editor

parameters.name: editor_button[selection_height]
parameters.description: The height of the dialog the tool is launched in

parameters.name: editor_button[selection_width]
parameters.description: The width of the dialog the tool is launched in

parameters.name: editor_button[url]
parameters.description: The url of the external tool

parameters.name: icon_url
parameters.description: The url of the icon to show for this tool

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the tool

parameters.name: not_selectable
parameters.description: Default: false, if set to true the tool won't show up in the externalntool selection UI in modules and assignments

parameters.name: privacy_level
parameters.description: What information to send to the external tool.nn        n        n          Allowed values: anonymous, name_only, public

parameters.name: resource_selection[enabled]
parameters.description: Set this to enable this feature

parameters.name: resource_selection[icon_url]
parameters.description: The url of the icon to show in the module external tool list

parameters.name: resource_selection[selection_height]
parameters.description: The height of the dialog the tool is launched in

parameters.name: resource_selection[selection_width]
parameters.description: The width of the dialog the tool is launched in

parameters.name: resource_selection[url]
parameters.description: The url of the external tool

parameters.name: shared_secret
parameters.description: The shared secret with the external tool

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The default text to show for this tool

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url to match links against. Either u201curlu201d or u201cdomainu201d should be set, notnboth.

parameters.name: user_navigation[enabled]
parameters.description: Set this to enable this feature

parameters.name: user_navigation[text]
parameters.description: The text that will show on the left-tab in the user navigation

parameters.name: user_navigation[url]
parameters.description: The url of the external tool for user navigation

get.summary: Get a sessionless launch url for an external tool.

parameters.name: assignment_id
parameters.description: The assignment id for an assignment launch.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The external id of the tool to launch.

parameters.name: launch_type
parameters.description: The type of launch to perform on the external tool.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The LTI launch url for the external tool.

parameters.name: locking_account_id
parameters.description: If set, this FeatureFlag may only be modified by someone withnadministrative rights in the specified account. The locking account must benabove the target object in the account chain.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: u201coffu201dnnThe feature is not available for the course, user, or account andnsub-accounts.nu201callowedu201dnn(valid only on accounts) The feature is off in the account, but may benenabled in sub-accounts and courses by setting a feature flag on thensub-account or course.nu201conu201dnnThe feature is turned on unconditionally for the user, course, or accountnand sub-accounts.nnn        n        n          Allowed values: off, allowed, on

parameters.name: grading_periods[][end_date]
parameters.description: no description

parameters.name: grading_periods[][start_date]
parameters.description: The date the grading period starts.

parameters.name: grading_periods[][weight]
parameters.description: The percentage weight of how much the period should count toward the coursengrade.

parameters.name: grading_periods[][end_date]
parameters.description: no description

parameters.name: grading_periods[][start_date]
parameters.description: The date the grading period starts.

parameters.name: grading_periods[][weight]
parameters.description: The percentage weight of how much the period should count toward the coursengrade.

get.summary: List the grading standards available in a context.

parameters.name: grading_scheme_entry[][name]
parameters.description: The name for an entry value within a GradingStandard that describes thenrange of the value e.g. A-

parameters.name: grading_scheme_entry[][value]
parameters.description: The value for the name of the entry within a GradingStandard. The entrynrepresents the lower bound of the range for the entry. This range includesnthe value up to the next entry in the GradingStandard, or 100 if there isnno upper bound. The lowest value will have a lower bound range of 0. e.g.n93

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title for the Grading Standard.

get.summary: List the groups available in a context.

parameters.name: only_own_groups
parameters.description: Will only include groups that the user belongs to if this is set

get.summary: List group categories for a context

parameters.name: auto_leader
parameters.description: Assigns group leaders automatically when generating and allocating studentsnto groups Valid values are:nu201cfirstu201dnnthe first student to be allocated to a group is the leadernu201crandomu201dnna random student from all members is chosen as the leadernnn        n        n          Allowed values: first, random

parameters.name: create_group_count
parameters.description: Create this number of groups (Course Only).

parameters.name: group_limit
parameters.description: Limit the maximum number of users in each group (Course Only). Requiresnself signup.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the group category

parameters.name: self_signup
parameters.description: Allow students to sign up for a group themselves (Course Only). validnvalues are:nu201cenabledu201dnnallows students to self sign up for any group in coursenu201crestrictedu201dnnallows students to self sign up only for groups in the same section nullndisallows self sign upnnn        n        n          Allowed values: enabled, restricted

parameters.name: split_group_count
parameters.description: (Deprecated) Create this number of groups, and evenly distribute studentsnamong them. not allowed with u201cenable_self_signupu201d. because the groupnassignment happens synchronously, it's recommended that you instead usenthe assign_unassigned_members endpoint. (Course Only)

parameters.name: login[authentication_provider_id]
parameters.description: The authentication provider this login is associated with. Loginsnassociated with a specific provider can only be used with that provider.nLegacy providers (LDAP, CAS, SAML) will search for logins associated withnthem, or unassociated logins. New providers will only search for loginsnexplicitly associated with them. This can be the integer ID of thenprovider, or the type of the provider (in which case, it will find thenfirst matching provider).

parameters.name: login[password]
parameters.description: The new login's password.

parameters.name: login[sis_user_id]
parameters.description: SIS ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able tonmanage SIS permissions on the account.

parameters.name: login[unique_id]
parameters.description: The unique ID for the new login.

parameters.name: user[id]
parameters.description: The ID of the user to create the login for.

parameters.name: login[password]
parameters.description: The new password for the login. Can only be set by an admin user if adminsnare allowed to change passwords for the account.

parameters.name: login[sis_user_id]
parameters.description: SIS ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able tonmanage SIS permissions on the account.

parameters.name: login[unique_id]
parameters.description: The new unique ID for the login.

get.summary: Get all outcome groups for context

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The new outcome group description.

parameters.name: parent_outcome_group_id
parameters.description: The id of the new parent outcome group.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The new outcome group title.

parameters.name: vendor_guid
parameters.description: A custom GUID for the learning standard.

parameters.name: source_outcome_group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the source outcome group.

parameters.name: calculation_int
parameters.description: The new calculation int.  Only applies if the calculation_method isnu201cdecaying_averageu201d or u201cn_masteryu201d

parameters.name: calculation_method
parameters.description: The new calculation method.  Defaults to u201chighestu201dnn        n        n          Allowed values: decaying_average, n_mastery, latest, highest

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the new outcome.

parameters.name: display_name
parameters.description: A friendly name shown in reports for outcomes with cryptic titles, such asncommon core standards names.

parameters.name: mastery_points
parameters.description: The mastery threshold for the embedded rubric criterion.

parameters.name: outcome_id
parameters.description: The ID of the existing outcome to link.

parameters.name: ratings[][description]
parameters.description: The description of a rating level for the embedded rubric criterion.

parameters.name: ratings[][points]
parameters.description: The points corresponding to a rating level for the embedded rubricncriterion.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the new outcome. Required if outcome_id is absent.

parameters.name: vendor_guid
parameters.description: A custom GUID for the learning standard.

parameters.name: calculation_int
parameters.description: The new calculation int.  Only applies if the calculation_method isnu201cdecaying_averageu201d or u201cn_masteryu201d

parameters.name: calculation_method
parameters.description: The new calculation method.  Defaults to u201chighestu201dnn        n        n          Allowed values: decaying_average, n_mastery, latest, highest

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the new outcome.

parameters.name: display_name
parameters.description: A friendly name shown in reports for outcomes with cryptic titles, such asncommon core standards names.

parameters.name: mastery_points
parameters.description: The mastery threshold for the embedded rubric criterion.

parameters.name: outcome_id
parameters.description: The ID of the existing outcome to link.

parameters.name: ratings[][description]
parameters.description: The description of a rating level for the embedded rubric criterion.

parameters.name: ratings[][points]
parameters.description: The points corresponding to a rating level for the embedded rubricncriterion.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the new outcome. Required if outcome_id is absent.

parameters.name: vendor_guid
parameters.description: A custom GUID for the learning standard.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the new outcome group.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the new outcome group.

parameters.name: vendor_guid
parameters.description: A custom GUID for the learning standard

get.summary: Get all outcome links for context

parameters.name: [parameters]
parameters.description: The parameters will vary for each report

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The id of the account to retrieve roles for.

parameters.name: show_inherited
parameters.description: If this argument is true, all roles inherited from parent accounts will benincluded.

parameters.name: state[]
parameters.description: Filter by role state. If this argument is omitted, only 'active'nroles are returned.nn        n        n          Allowed values: active, inactive

parameters.name: base_role_type
parameters.description: Specifies the role type that will be used as a base for the permissionsngranted to this role.nnDefaults to 'AccountMembership' if absentnn        n        n          Allowed values: AccountMembership, StudentEnrollment, TeacherEnrollment, TaEnrollment, ObserverEnrollment, DesignerEnrollment

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label for the role.

parameters.name: permissions[<X>][enabled]
parameters.description: If explicit is 1 and enabled is 1, permission <X> will be explicitlyngranted to this role. If explicit is 1 and enabled has any other valuen(typically 0), permission <X> will be explicitly denied to this role.nIf explicit is any other value (typically 0) or absent, or if enabled isnabsent, the value for permission <X> will be inherited from upstream.nIgnored if permission <X> is locked upstream (in an ancestornaccount).nnMay occur multiple times with unique values for <X>. Recognizednpermission names for <X> are:nn[For Account-Level Roles Only]nbecome_user                      -- Become other usersnmanage_account_memberships       -- Add/remove other admins for the accountnmanage_account_settings          -- Manage account-level settingsnmanage_alerts                    -- Manage global alertsnmanage_courses                   -- Manage ( add / edit / delete ) coursesnmanage_developer_keys            -- Manage developer keysnmanage_global_outcomes           -- Manage learning outcomesnmanage_jobs                      -- Manage background jobsnmanage_role_overrides            -- Manage permissionsnmanage_storage_quotas            -- Set storage quotas for courses, groups, and usersnmanage_sis                       -- Import and manage SIS datanmanage_site_settings             -- Manage site-wide and plugin settingsnmanage_user_logins               -- Modify login details for usersnread_course_content              -- View course contentnread_course_list                 -- View the list of coursesnread_messages                    -- View notifications sent to usersnsite_admin                       -- Use the Site Admin section and admin all other accountsnview_error_reports               -- View error reportsnview_statistics                  -- View statisticsnmanage_feature_flags             -- Enable or disable features at an account levelnn[For both Account-Level and Course-Level roles]n Note: Applicable enrollment types for course-level roles are given in brackets:n       S = student, T = teacher, A = TA, D = designer, O = observer.n       Lower-case letters indicate permissions that are off by default.n       A missing letter indicates the permission cannot be enabled for the rolen       or any derived custom roles.nchange_course_state              -- [ TaD ] Change course statencomment_on_others_submissions    -- [sTAD ] View all students' submissions and make comments on themncreate_collaborations            -- [STADo] Create student collaborationsncreate_conferences               -- [STADo] Create web conferencesnmanage_admin_users               -- [ Tad ] Add/remove other teachers, course designers or TAs to the coursenmanage_assignments               -- [ TADo] Manage (add / edit / delete) assignments and quizzesnmanage_calendar                  -- [sTADo] Add, edit and delete events on the course calendarnmanage_content                   -- [ TADo] Manage all other course contentnmanage_files                     -- [ TADo] Manage (add / edit / delete) course filesnmanage_grades                    -- [ TA  ] Edit gradesnmanage_groups                    -- [ TAD ] Manage (create / edit / delete) groupsnmanage_interaction_alerts        -- [ Ta  ] Manage alertsnmanage_outcomes                  -- [sTaDo] Manage learning outcomesnmanage_sections                  -- [ TaD ] Manage (create / edit / delete) course sectionsnmanage_students                  -- [ TAD ] Add/remove students for the coursenmanage_user_notes                -- [ TA  ] Manage faculty journal entriesnmanage_rubrics                   -- [ TAD ] Edit assessing rubricsnmanage_wiki                      -- [ TADo] Manage wiki (add / edit / delete pages)nread_forum                       -- [STADO] View discussionsnmoderate_forum                   -- [sTADo] Moderate discussions (delete/edit others' posts, lock topics)npost_to_forum                    -- [STADo] Post to discussionsnread_question_banks              -- [ TADo] View and link to question banksnread_reports                     -- [ TAD ] View usage reports for the coursenread_roster                      -- [STADo] See the list of usersnread_sis                         -- [sTa  ] Read SIS datansend_messages                    -- [STADo] Send messages to individual course membersnsend_messages_all                -- [sTADo] Send messages to the entire classnview_all_grades                  -- [ TAd ] View all gradesnview_group_pages                 -- [sTADo] View the group pages of all student groupsnnnSome of these permissions are applicable only for roles on the site adminnaccount, on a root account, or for course-level roles with a particularnbase role type; if a specified permission is inapplicable, it will benignored.nnAdditional permissions may exist based on installed plugins.

parameters.name: permissions[<X>][explicit]
parameters.description: no description

parameters.name: permissions[<X>][locked]
parameters.description: If the value is 1, permission <X> will be locked downstream (newnroles in subaccounts cannot override the setting). For any other value,npermission <X> is left unlocked. Ignored if permission <X> isnalready locked upstream. May occur multiple times with unique values forn<X>.

parameters.description: The communication channel address, e.g. the user's email address.

parameters.description: User's login ID. Must be a valid email address.

parameters.description: The user's birth date.

parameters.name: user[locale]
parameters.description: The user's preferred language as a two-letter ISO 639-1 code.

parameters.description: The full name of the user. This name will be used by teacher for grading.

parameters.description: User's name as it will be displayed in discussions, messages, andncomments.

parameters.description: The time zone for the user. Allowed time zones arenIANA time zones or friendliernRuby on Rails time zones.

parameters.name: created_since
parameters.description: If set, only shows imports created after the specified date (use ISO8601nformat)

parameters.name: add_sis_stickiness
parameters.description: This option, if present, will process all changes as if they were UInchanges. This means that u201cstickinessu201d will be added to changed fields. Thisnoption is only processed if 'override_sis_stickiness' is alsonprovided.

parameters.name: attachment
batch_mode
parameters.description: If set, this SIS import will be run in batch mode, deleting any datanpreviously imported via SIS that is not present in this latest import. Seenthe SIS CSV Format page for details.

parameters.name: batch_mode_term_id
parameters.description: Limit deletions to only this term. Required if batch mode is enabled.

parameters.name: clear_sis_stickiness
parameters.description: This option, if present, will clear u201cstickinessu201d from all fields touched bynthis import. Requires that 'override_sis_stickiness' is alsonprovided. If 'add_sis_stickiness' is also provided,n'clear_sis_stickiness' will overrule the behavior ofn'add_sis_stickiness'

parameters.name: diffing_data_set_identifier
parameters.description: If set on a CSV import, Canvas will attempt to optimize the SIS import byncomparing this set of CSVs to the previous set that has the same data setnidentifier, and only appliying the difference between the two. See the SISnCSV Format documentation for more details.

parameters.name: diffing_remaster_data_set
parameters.description: If true, and diffing_data_set_identifier is sent, this SIS import will benpart of the data set, but diffing will not be performed. See the SIS CSVnFormat documentation for details.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: Recommended for raw post request style imports. This field will be used tondistinguish between zip, xml, csv, and other file format extensions thatnwould usually be provided with the filename in the multipart post requestnscenario. If not provided, this value will be inferred from thenContent-Type, falling back to zip-file format if all else fails.

parameters.name: import_type
parameters.description: Choose the data format for reading SIS data. With a standard Canvasninstall, this option can only be 'instructure_csv', and ifnunprovided, will be assumed to be so. Can be part of the query string.

parameters.name: override_sis_stickiness
parameters.description: Many fields on records in Canvas can be marked u201csticky,u201d which means thatnwhen something changes in the UI apart from the SIS, that field getsnu201cstuck.u201d In this way, by default, SIS imports do not override UI changes.nIf this field is present, however, it will tell the SIS import to ignorenu201cstickinessu201d and override all fields.

get.summary: Get the sub-accounts of an account

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: If true, the entire account tree underneath this account will be returnedn(though still paginated). If false, only direct sub-accounts of thisnaccount will be returned. Defaults to false.

parameters.description: The default group storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

parameters.description: The day/time the term ends. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g.n2015-01-10T18:48:00Z.

parameters.description: The name of the term.

parameters.name: enrollment_term[sis_term_id]
parameters.description: The unique SIS identifier for the term.

parameters.description: The day/time the term starts. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g.n2015-01-10T18:48:00Z.

parameters.name: enrollment_term[end_at]
parameters.description: The day/time the term ends. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g.n2015-01-10T18:48:00Z.

parameters.name: enrollment_term[name]

parameters.name: enrollment_term[sis_term_id]
parameters.description: The unique SIS identifier for the term.

parameters.name: enrollment_term[start_at]
parameters.description: The day/time the term starts. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g.n2015-01-10T18:48:00Z.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the resultsnlist. Must be at least 3 characters.nnNote that the API will prefer matching on canonical user ID if the ID has annumeric form. It will only search against other fields if non-numeric innform, or if the numeric value doesn't yield any matches. Queries bynadministrative users will search on SIS ID, name, or email address; non-nadministrative queries will only be compared against name.

parameters.name: communication_channel[address]
parameters.description: The communication channel address, e.g. the user's email address.

parameters.name: communication_channel[confirmation_url]
parameters.description: Only valid for account admins. If true, returns the new user accountnconfirmation URL in the response.

parameters.name: communication_channel[skip_confirmation]
parameters.description: Only valid for site admins and account admins making requests; If true, thenchannel is automatically validated and no confirmation email or SMS isnsent. Otherwise, the user must respond to a confirmation message to confirmnthe channel.nnIf this is true, it is recommended to setn"pseudonym[send_confirmation]" to true as well.nOtherwise, the user will not receive any messages about their accountncreation.

parameters.name: communication_channel[type]
parameters.description: The communication channel type, e.g. 'email' or 'sms'.

parameters.name: enable_sis_reactivation
parameters.description: When true, will first try to re-activate a deleted user with matchingnsis_user_id if possible.

parameters.name: force_validations
parameters.description: If true, validations are performed on the newly created user (and theirnassociated pseudonym) even if the request is made by a privileged user likenan admin. When set to false, or not included in the request parameters, anynnewly created users are subject to validations unless the request is madenby a user with a 'manage_user_logins' right. In which case, certainnvalidations such as 'require_acceptance_of_terms' andn'require_presence_of_name' are not enforced. Use this parameter tonreturn helpful json errors while building users with an admin request.

parameters.name: pseudonym[authentication_provider_id]
parameters.description: The authentication provider this login is associated with. Loginsnassociated with a specific provider can only be used with that provider.nLegacy providers (LDAP, CAS, SAML) will search for logins associated withnthem, or unassociated logins. New providers will only search for loginsnexplicitly associated with them. This can be the integer ID of thenprovider, or the type of the provider (in which case, it will find thenfirst matching provider).

parameters.name: pseudonym[force_self_registration]
parameters.description: Send user a self-registration style email if true. Setting it means thenusers will get a notification asking them to u201ccomplete the registrationnprocessu201d by clicking it, setting a password, and letting them in.  Willnonly be executed on if the user does not need admin approval. Defaults tonfalse unless explicitly provided.

parameters.name: pseudonym[password]
parameters.description: User's password. Cannot be set during self-registration.

parameters.name: pseudonym[send_confirmation]
parameters.description: Send user notification of account creation if true. Automatically set tontrue during self-registration.

parameters.name: pseudonym[sis_user_id]
parameters.description: SIS ID for the user's account. To set this parameter, the caller mustnbe able to manage SIS permissions.

parameters.name: pseudonym[unique_id]
parameters.description: User's login ID. If this is a self-registration, it must be a validnemail address.

parameters.name: user[birthdate]
parameters.description: The user's birth date.

parameters.name: user[locale]
parameters.description: The user's preferred language as a two-letter ISO 639-1 code.

parameters.name: user[name]
parameters.description: The full name of the user. This name will be used by teacher for grading.nRequired if this is a self-registration.

parameters.name: user[short_name]
parameters.description: User's name as it will be displayed in discussions, messages, andncomments.

parameters.name: user[skip_registration]
parameters.description: Automatically mark the user as registered.nnIf this is true, it is recommended to setn"pseudonym[send_confirmation]" to true as well.nOtherwise, the user will not receive any messages about their accountncreation.nnThe users communication channel confirmation can be skipped by settingn"communication_channel[skip_confirmation]" to truenas well.

parameters.name: user[sortable_name]
parameters.description: User's name as used to sort alphabetically in lists.

parameters.name: user[terms_of_use]
parameters.description: Whether the user accepts the terms of use. Required if this is anself-registration and this canvas instance requires users to accept thenterms (on by default).nnIf this is true, it will mark the user as having accepted the terms of use.

parameters.name: user[time_zone]
parameters.description: The time zone for the user. Allowed time zones arenIANA time zones or friendliernRuby on Rails time zones.
